titleStmt.title: Heauens ioy, or, Heauen begun vpon earth Wherein there is discouered more plainely than euer formerly. The happy and surpassing glorious estate of a iustified person, or a saint on earth. Also that greater happinesse at the day of iudgement. And a small tast of that greatest and most glorious estate prepared for vs in the highest heauens. Also the writer will bee ready to defend what is here written against all opposers whatsoeuer.
titleStmt.author: Traske, John, d. ca. 1638, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. C[reede] and B. A[lsop] for Iohn Harrison [2]; and are to be sold in Pater-noster Row, at the signe of the Golden Anker,

notesStmt.note: Possibly by John Traske; on A4r is a note that STC 24175.3 (Traske, John. Christs kingdome discovered) is worth reading, and both items have a similar manner of exposition.--STC.
Printers' names and identification of publisher from STC.
Imperfect: A1, title page, mended; K4 torn, affecting text; L8 defective.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
